plan: To maximize profits, I will initially bid my exact valuation for Goods A and B independently, promoting aggressive and potentially risky strategies to collect data on opponents. I will bid $57 for Good A and $8 for Good B. For combined goods AB, I'll consider bidding above the sum of individual values due to its increased value ($130), testing whether bidding closer to combined value results in wins. I will then revise my strategies based on price history, shift my bids, and adjust my aggression level accordingly to increase the chances of successful bids.

I plan to start aggressively by bidding $99 for item B, reflecting its higher value to me. For item A, I will bid a moderate $30 to observe the bidding habits of Andy and Charles. By following this, I could secure item B heavily while understanding the bid ranges of my competitors. In subsequent rounds, I'll adapt my strategy based on the bidding pattern, trending towards my value for each unit, and adjust my bids for AB to reflect combined benefits, approaching $78 over time, also still considering my competitors' habits.

Initially, I will test a safe strategy, bidding slightly above my valuations for A (21) and B (24). Observing rivals' tendencies, I may later implement riskier strategies, possibly bidding closer to my AB value (86) if competition is high. Additionally, I will experiment with aggressive bidding, offering substantially higher values to understand the maximum bids of Andy and Betty. All strategies will be evaluated based on profit margin and adjusted accordingly. By alternating among these methods, I aim to maximize my overall profit in the long-run and avoid predictability.

For Round 1, I'll bid $57 for A to analyze opponents' change in strategy. For B, I'll cautiously bid $17 to test for win feasibility without exceeding my valuation. This allows testing different strategies while focusing on maximizing profit.

This round, I'll adopt a balanced approach. I'll bid $89 for good A, a value slightly higher than its actual worth to me. For good B, I'll bid $58, which is just above my valuation. This strategy aims to secure both goods while potentially increasing profit.
